title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.7: MULTI COUNTRY - Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH)

description.narrative: Output 2.7: Multi Country - Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) Communities, schools and health centers use improved water and sanitation facilities with a focus on outer islands, rural and peri-urban villages, which contributes to Hygiene, Sanitation, Wash And Emergencies, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: H&S Programme Component Results (PCR) 2: Children and families benefit from equitable and sustainable access to safe drinking water, improved sanitation and hygiene within communities that are increasingly resilient to the impact of climate change and natural disasters.

mailing-address.narrative: 3rd & 5th Floors FDB Building 360 Victoria Parade Suva

sector.narrative: Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
Water - climate resilience and environmental sustainability
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.7: Multi Country - WASH Communities, schools and health centers use improved water and sanitation facilities with afocus on outer islands, rural and peri-urban villages

description.narrative: WASH in Schools programmes were expanded in Fiji, Vanuatu, Kiribati and Solomon Islands and introduced in the Federated States of Micronesia, support was provided in Fiji and Kiribati to strengthen WASH in health care facilities and government monitoring structures, and in Solomon Islands for Community-Led Total Sanitation activities. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:18/12/2017
